qas.question: What languages do residents of Norfolk Island speak?

answers.text: English and a creole language known as Norfuk

qas.question: What is the Norfuk language a mixture of?
The Norfuk language of Norfolk Island was first spoken by whom?

answers.text: descendants of the first free settlers of Norfolk Island who were descendants of the settlers of Pitcairn Island

qas.question: What is the official co-language of Norfolk Island?
What part of the residents of Norfolk Island could speak Norfuk as of 2011?

plausible_answers.text: English and a creole language known as Norfuk

qas.question: What languages do residents of Norfolk Island restrict?
What is the Norfuk language not influenced by?
What is the unofficial co-language of Norfolk Island?
What portion of the residents of Norfolk Island don't understand any Norfuk as of 2011?

context: Islanders speak both <a0_0><b5_0>English and a creole language known as Norfuk<b5_0/><a0_0/>, a blend of <a1_0><b6_0>18th-century English and Tahitian<b6_0/><a1_0/>. <a3_0><b7_0>The Norfuk language<b7_0/><a3_0/> is decreasing in popularity as more tourists travel to the island and more young people leave for work and study reasons; however, there are efforts to keep it alive via dictionaries and the renaming of some tourist attractions to their Norfuk equivalents. In 2004 an act of the Norfolk Island Assembly made it a co-official language of the island. The act is long-titled: "An Act to recognise the Norfolk Island Language (Norf'k) as an official language of Norfolk Island." The "language known as 'Norf'k'" is described as the language "that is spoken by <a2_0>descendants of the first free settlers of Norfolk Island who were descendants of the settlers of Pitcairn Island<a2_0/>". The act recognises and protects use of the language but does not require it; in official use, it must be accompanied by an accurate translation into English. 32% of the total population reported speaking a language other than English in the 2011 census, and just <a4_0><b8_0>under three-quarters<b8_0/><a4_0/> of the ordinarily resident population could speak Norfuk.
